column4: Hello. How can I install the "NVIDIA Accelerated graphics driver  (version 180)" from the command line? I cannot do it via the "Restricted Drivers" GUI because the window is bigger than the screen
did you already download them?
I don't think so. (Just in case, I just want to install it from the .deb in the official repos)
first download them from the nvidia website
ah ok
then you don't want my answer ;)
why only the ubuntu repos?
in a console, type "apt-cache search nvidia"
Because I haven't had any problem with the official .debs. If ain't broken, don't fix it ;-)
then take note of the name that you are interested in
lol you're right. You certainly don't want the development files though.
then "apt-get install my_drivers"
I already did that, but there are several packages (and one of them is installed). Here's the output: http://pastebin.com/fe787663
replace my_drivers obviously
Which of them should I install?
nvidia-glx-180 seems to be the one, but I'm not sure
I guess the installed one is modalias, I would assume the one you need is p   nvidia-glx-180
OK, thank you. I'm going to install it! :)
you can do "apt-cache show my_package" to get information about my_package
ok, have fun, hope it works
by the way, are you sure these are the drivers you need? did you do a little research first?
Yes, that's the package suggested by the Restricted Drivers app. I couldn't installed with it because the current resolution is 640x480 and this program is bigger, so I couldn't click "enable"
ok, just asking because in my case the ubuntu app suggested one that wasn't up-to-date and made my system crash until I reconfigure xorg.conf
that's why I use a nvidia driver..
